review.reviewBody:
The 10wt model is perfect for saltwater in the northeast. It can send massive flies on windy days with no problem. Big improvement on my casting distance.

The 4-star rating is for Backcountry, the rod itself is easy 5-stars. It did not indicate that the 10wt was the 1091-4 model (special Pike/Musky rod) instead of the standard 1090-4. From what I can tell, the only difference is a slightly longer fighting butt and I actually kind of love it, so not a big deal for me personally.
review.name: Best Rod for the Money

review.reviewBody: I used the large cover with an Osprey Aura 65 and had lots of room. It kept everything dry through multiple days of rain and then was quick to dry as well. It is a little difficult to cinch up the draw string round the pack, but not that bad, therefore 4 instead of 5 stars. The little integrated bag is handy.
review.name: Fits just fine

review.reviewBody: I bought this to use as a rain cover for my referee backpack and it does the job. when there is rain in the forecast I pack this in my backpack and have it ready if I need it. The material is great at covering my backpack and is comfortable to be left on the backpack and worn. I just wish I would have ordered a size XS instead of a small one. The cover has too much extra space and is only necessary when I need to take my referee jacket and track pants off and keep them dry.
review.name: Referee backpack rain cover

review.reviewBody: They say size large fits 60-100L. I mean, it will fit, but not if you put anything inside your pack. This wouldn't even fit my 55L pack
review.name: Don't believe the size description

name: Backpack Rain Cover

review.reviewBody: Good rain pants but heavier than advertised (by about 1/3). I tried on and weighted the medium and the large, but were about 200 gr. Cut was nice, functional, no extra design stuff that I did not need. The large would have fit but I returned because of the weight.
review.name: Good rain pants, heavier than advertised

review.reviewBody: Love how it fits. This is a great product that is comfy and looks nice. Great for many different activities.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: Great lightweight rain paints - do what they are intended to do.   And a great warranty, as my seams split after 4 years of good usage, and OR completely warrantied them
review.name: Great lightweight rain paints!

review.reviewBody: Same material as the Helium Rain Jacket. Sizing is perfect. Keeps me dry for short periods of time. Don't expect these to keep you dry all day! They work for an hour or so then wet through, but that's expected. These are excellent for through hiking when weight means everything!
review.name: Top Rated for Ultra Light Hikers

review.reviewBody: Seem to fit true to size. I'm 5'10" 160lbs and wear 30/32 pants. These fit over most of my pants without a problem and I haven't had any issues with movement restriction. These have been a great addition to my foul weather gear for my boat.
review.name: Good foul-weather pants

review.reviewBody: Pay close attention to the waterproof rating on this. The weight savings and packability come with a tradeoff. Anything more than a light drizzle and the rain will quickly soak through. Would not recommend if you plan on taking into the backcountry in the cold/wet months
review.name: Great gear if you prioritize weight over staying dry

review.reviewBody: Very impressed with the waterproofing for such a lightweight pant. I bought these primarily for bike commuting in the northwest coast of British Columbia and they've kept me completely dry with water coming from all directions. The large/tall are a perfect fit for me (6'4" 175lbs). Have yet to trial these on extended hikes, but I'm optimistic that the light weight and solid waterproofing will make them a good addition to the gear. Only change I would make right now would be to have a front pocket rather than a rear pocket. Will see if they are durable in the long term, but I've been using an OR rain jacket for the past 6 years and it's still keeping me dry so hopefully these pants meet that standard.
review.name: Lightweight rain gear keeping me dry

review.reviewBody: Convenient to just put it in your bag and take it out when it rains.
review.name: Lightweight

review.reviewBody: Used them is heavy rain with a good coat and they worked wonderfully. Pricey but with the purchase
review.name: Great pants!

review.reviewBody: Bought these to add to my biking/ hiking pack. Been carrying the jacket around for years and has been great during bouts of rain on the trail . The pants will complete the kit . I sized up so I could wear over my hiking pants and they fit great. Expect to get many years from these pants if the jacket is any indication.They both pack down incredibly small and are a great piece of kit.
review.name: Helium pant

name: Helium Rain Pant - Men's

description: Buy the Black Diamond MiniWire Alpine Quickdraw online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: MiniWire Alpine Quickdraw
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond MiniWire Alpine Quickdraw online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The sling is really nice, smooth and lightweight. The mini wire carabiners are ergonomic and easy to clip! Definitely recommend for a lightweight and functional alpine draw!
review.name: Great draw, great quality!

review.reviewBody: Black Diamond Quik draws are the finest made! Get a couple and try them out! You’ll be sold for life!
review.name: Alpine Quikdraw

review.reviewBody: Perfect for the trad rack. Wasn’t sure about the miniwires instead of full size but so far I’ve enjoyed using them.
review.name: Good for trad climbing

review.reviewBody: Great draw that works for overhanging sport and anytime you need a 60cm sling.
review.name: Mini wire alpine draw

review.reviewBody: Super paired down, these draws are ideal in alpine settings especially ice climbing. I’ve been using them year round because they’re so light but their best suited, for me, to ice climbing.
review.name: Light right

review.reviewBody: I don’t really use this for alpine mainly trad, maybe it should be called “Trad QuickDraw.”
review.name: Alpine

review.reviewBody: functional alpine draw. haven’t had any problems with them. i like them for nut placements
What more could you ask or need? Light, long enough, always handy!
review.name: Perfect alpine draw!

review.reviewBody:
The new tubular webbing used is a bit interesting, i usually like a standard dyneema sling, but with the same strength rating, this racks smaller and lighter; I'm curious as to how durable the sheath will be... but so far so good, would definitely buy another!

Smaller biners make it  a bit interesting to clip if you're not used to them, and I do usually like obviously different colored biners to designate a rope and a gear side, but some nail polish helps with that.
review.name: Lightweight, Great Alpines

review.reviewBody:
These alpine quickdraws draw their soul from the miniwire carabiner. My only complaint seems to have been addressed: my first three of these came with two light-gray carabiners. I changed one for a miniwire octane to keep track of the rope carabiner and keep the gray one for clipping metallic stuff. The last one I got came with a light-gray + gray configuration which helps those (perfectionist and self-diagnosed OCD) climbers like me tell them apart.

Please make that gorgeous runner available for purchase separately!
review.name: Ultralight ultrathin ultranice alpine quickdraw

name: MiniWire Alpine Quickdraw

review.reviewBody: The cuffs are awesome with how heavy duty they are. Fit true to size and the flex makes them a game changer.
review.name: Best pants

review.reviewBody: I ordered the wrong size. Thought I was a large, but the large fit really big, so i would probably need a medium. Great product otherwise.

honestly the sexiest pants I have ever worn, let me tell you, when I roll up to the club in my Men's Hemishpere's II Gortex Bibs, the ladies just start flocking to me. I actually have decided to only wear them in winter now since I have been getting too much attention from the fairer gender. Thanks Outdoor Research for spicing up my dating life with these bibs
review.name: I love these pants

review.reviewBody: They are light weight so good for warmer wet days The pockets are too high to access while sitting on the chair lift. Would be nicer if they were more on the thigh like a cargo pocket The cuffs are reinforced but it would be nice if they had something to cinch them up around the boots. The internal gaiter is just a little too loose for my liking
review.name: Pretty light weight so good for warm wet days

review.reviewBody: I have approximately half my season (8-10 days) in these bibs and I could not be happier with them. From the ripstop cuffs (truly the beefiest I have ever owned, counting past ORs, North Face, HH), to the avy beacon pocket (there are 2 options - armpit or right thigh), to the smart placement of the stretchy GTX panels, these have been fantastic. Other reviewers have mentioned being cold in them, but I havent had that experience. I live in CO and regularly ski in single digits or slightly below zero F with only a base layer underneath and have never felt cold (outside of 1st chair when you sit down and the chair is still frozen solid). They are fantastic for touring - great range of mobility, excellent venting, good storage. Also just as good on resort days. A
review.name: I regret not making the switch to these sooner

review.reviewBody: Where these really shine is in the backcountry due to how light they are and how they stretch as you move, but I've used them extensively at the resort and even snowmobiling and they've never let me down. Undoubtedly the most comfortable bibs I've used and I've never gotten wet in them, unlike my previous bibs made by another brand. They're surprisingly thin so I I do use other snow pants for work activities like dragging brush and digging in the dirt, but they'll keep you dry in the snow and slush without feeling cumbersome during high-output activities. Mine are 2 seasons old so I'm not sure if they've changed at all. 6' and 180 lbs in a size Large.
review.name: Waterproof and comfortable!

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, dry and exactly what they should be. Great shell pants.
review.name: Exactly as advertised

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'11" 185 with an athletic build and am right between a medium and large. I ended up buying a large for a more relaxed fit/layering and have no regrets on sizing. Overall they feel high quality and are wind/water proof as advertised. Even in cold temps despite being only a shell they hold body heat well with a mid weight base layer. I've got 7 resort days with them so far mostly in the glades and bumps and while they are very comfortable they already have small tears in the reinforced cuffs from my ski edges. Also the button at the top of the side entry zipper broke on the 2nd day simply unbuttoning it. That button isn't necessary, but a little disappointing given the price point. Would be 5 stars without these quality issues out the gate.
review.name: Great bibs with a QC concern

review.reviewBody: Great product. Never had an issue with getting wet. Plenty of pockets and well placed zippers for ventilation.
review.name: Hemisphere II GORE-TEX Bibs

review.reviewBody: I bought this to handle both resort and backcountry skiing after resisting the urge to upgrade my 6-year-old non-venting snow pants. I'm 5'9 155lbs with a slightly athletic build, and the small fits perfect for me. I am really happy about the durability of the scuff guards and overall material. The zippers do not catch either and allow plenty of venting. They're comfy, allows plenty of room to layer, and good flexibility to move. I have about 6 days on them so far (5 resort, 1 backcountry) and my only complaint would be that I would have hoped for an extra pocket or two and maybe a reinforced knee given how expensive they are. Overall, quality is high but a small knock for lack of the previously mentioned features given the price point.
review.name: Comfortable all-round bib

review.reviewBody: Nice Hat! I was a little apprehensive ordering a hat online, but it turned out to be a great experience with Back Country! Fast Delivery! No problems whatsoever!
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: Really nice, well made hat.  I wear a size 7 1/4 so I ordered the large which could also fit 7 3/8, so it is just a bit large, but a hat size reducer fixed that issue.  It is crushable, but not as easy as other crushable hats.  Looks good and waiting to see how it handles inclement weather.  Great service from Backcountry made it a positive experience with a great product.
review.name: Jackson, Nice Hat

review.reviewBody: This was my first Stetson and like the many other reviews, mine also ran small. Although I measured prior to purchasing, the size small was very tight. Backcountry’s customer service is great though, going to return and exchange for a medium. Other then the size issue, the hat is beautiful and well made!
review.name: Jackson

review.reviewBody:
I own many Stetson hats, both sized and the "pick a size" - Sz. Small through XL sizing on their hats. I purchased a size medium in this hat. I should've paid attention to what different reviews were saying on different sites. This Stetson "Jackson Hat" is clearly flawed in its sizing; sizing that Stetson has clearly failed in making this hat. It's clearly apparent that this specific hat is made/sized completely wrong. They're too small! Stetson's molds or whatever they're using to make the sizing of these specific "Jackson" hats are clearly wrong. 

This is frustrating and disappointing because a company like Stetson should NOT be having any sizing issues in their production. They've been around way too long to have inconsistent sizing on their main product - HATS! Not even stretching this hat with a hat stretcher, for over three weeks, has helped. Obviously because when they make these hats and put them through the hot water and other systems to make them, they're going to always go back to the shape that they made them - which again, Stetson, your sizing on these hats is wrong!!! Do better Stetson! You're well known for one thing... Fix your sizing issues!
review.name: Sizing Off On These Jackson Hats

review.reviewBody:
It is well constructed.  The 'sage' is actually a dark green (think "Christmas elf") which was slightly disappointing.  The felt has a bit of fur (some sites say 5% fur + merino wool) and is much denser and softer than their 100% wool crushers.  This should make it a better outdoor hat, more wind and rain resistant, but the felt is rather light and thin - akin to a nice town hat.  I don't care for the bash but it should reshape easily with a bit of steam.  

Stetson has it's own info wrong:  there is a tag on it that says "100% wool" - it's not.  Another tag says crushable - I wouldn't recommend it.  They also say bound edge but it is raw, as seen in the pics.  Likewise, they say the sweatband is "Dri-lex leather" which isn't a thing, it's just Dri-lex.   As for size: I'm 57cm and found a Med to be too tight.  It wore fine tilted back like a hipster but I couldn't pull it down in front comfortably for proper use outdoors.  I'm returning it and continuing my hunt for a quality felt woods hat.  Hope this helps.
review.name: More fashionable than useful.

review.reviewBody: So the hat is fantastic, but the liner is not attached to the inside of the hat and doesn’t even appear to be cut for this hat, as it’s not fitted to the hat at all. Didn’t expect that from a Stetson.
review.name: Love the hat, but…

name: Jackson Hat

review.reviewBody: I was really looking forward to this jersey and wanted to pair it with the Castelli  Free Aero RC short (as pictured on the model).  The material feels top quality but unfortunately the cut of the jersey didn't work for me (long sleeves, short everywhere else, lol). I'm 5'6 127 lbs and the jersey was too short through the back and torso.  I tried a size Medium which fit more snug like a jersey should but it rode up terribly; size Large was too baggy in the chest and still rode up. Definitely didn't work with shorts; may be a better jersey to pair with bibs, which may help keep the jersey in place better. I'll be looking for a different jersey in a similar color.
review.name: Nice materials, too short

review.reviewBody: I am 5'11" 175lbs and I wear a medium in everything but in this i needed a large. The torso part of these fit very tight. In the medium with an r1 on I could barely get it to zip up. But the large fits perfect. They are very stretchy and the BD dry stuff works great. I use them for touring and resort stuff and I will probably never own anything different as long as BD keeps making these.
review.name: Runs small

review.reviewBody: i like the baggy fit which allows layerings depending whether being in or outside the resort. the top comes off and the front can flap over the belt which was super helpful during really hot touring days. the top kangaroo pocket is super useful for holding phones and snacks
review.name: great do it all bib

review.reviewBody: Yet to use, but decided to switch from dakine bibs for the season. I am 5’7” 150lbs w a short inseam and couldn’t make the smalls work w layers, exchanged for medium and a much better fit. Only complaint is the gaiters seem too wide and not adjustable. The built in belt is nice but not very functional. Curious to see how well the breath and can dump heat touring w only side zips
review.name: Yet to use, but decided

review.reviewBody: Huge pockets, well thought out beacon pocket, modern design/fit, every cuff is adjustable, and the materials/seams are skookum. Very clearly designed by people who ski. This + the stretch shell and first light hoody is all you need for south-central AK touring or the coldest day at Alyeska
review.name: Best bib I’ve owned

review.reviewBody: Really like the nice fit of the bibs and the ability to raise the legs with the bib straps so they don't drag on the ground. Also they are much lighter than I expected and should be awesome for touring.
review.name: Comfy and Light

review.reviewBody: Bought these pants last season and have been using them all over the mountain. Keeps everything dry and tons of great pockets. Mainly a shell so wearing some base layers is best case, and fits snug around the chest so maybe size up!
review.name: Amazing Ski Pants!

review.reviewBody: Very sturdy construction. Love the stretch. Seems more than ample for wet powder days and tours. Excited for next season.
review.name: Solid bibs

review.reviewBody: Excellent quality and super comfortable! I recommend it!
review.name: EXCELLENT PRODUCT!

review.reviewBody: I purchased these pants a couple weeks ago specifically for a trip to Utah.  I wanted something that would handle both front side and the back country....as well as something with reinforced gators.  I had cheaper Mountain Hardwear pants that weren't reinforced in the gator area and didn't hold out the snow.   I really liked the fit of the Recon and they really hold in wet conditions.  However, I'm disappointed with the durability.  After 3 days of skiing (2 at Alta and 1 in the back country), I noticed that the gators were ripped and giving way.  I get that it might happen, but not after a few days of skiing.  So, the main reason that I purchased the pants is now out the window. Was hoping for better from these.
review.name: The Good and the Bad

review.reviewBody:
These bibs are bombproof and comfortable to wear , keeping your dry from rain at the bottom of the mountain to full ice over at the top
I highly recommend this product
review.name: Awesome bibs

name: Recon Stretch Bib Pant - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Del Dia Allpa 30L Gear Hauler Tote
review.reviewBody: I use this bag for school as a teacher, and I love it so much! The colors are so vibrant, and it carries all of my work materials! (Lunchbox, water bottle, purse, hat and mittens!)
review.name: Best bag!

review.itemreviewed: Del Dia Allpa 30L Gear Hauler Tote
review.reviewBody: I am a big lover of all Cotopaxi bags and packs and never leave the house (or country) without one. This was the perfect addition to the collection! Great colors, great size, and great pocket. Will be the perfect thing for hauling stuff around this holiday season!!
review.name: Cotopaxi does it again!!

review.itemreviewed: Del Dia Allpa 30L Gear Hauler Tote
review.reviewBody: I love this bag! I have both sizes and I love them. . I just wish I could have picked or had a say in what color combo I would have wanted instead of mystery. Its a gamble and while I love my bag for all the many ways to use it- it is not actually my color preference. . . that aside- best best all purpose bag and recommend everyone get one!
review.name: love but. . .

review.itemreviewed: Del Dia Allpa 30L Gear Hauler Tote
review.reviewBody: I bought this as a work and weekend adventure tote. It's a great size and I can't help but want to use it for everything! The only complaint I have is that it doesn't have a strap that closes it together on top, or a zipper, and sometimes things seem like they will fall out.
review.name: Feels great, wish it closed on top

review.itemreviewed: Del Dia Allpa 30L Gear Hauler Tote
review.reviewBody: Not too big not too small! Great for bring everything we need for kids soccer games or any outing. Fits snacks, water bottles and changes of clothes along with my daily essentials perfectly.
review.name: Love this bag!

review.itemreviewed: Del Dia Allpa 30L Gear Hauler Tote
review.reviewBody: Hello! I am loving the new gear hauler tote bag. I did the *surprise me* colors and it turned out great. I actually started using it as my every day bag between home and work and haven't put it down since. I love the pockets and the webbing to hook stuff to on the outside. My main complaint is that the sides are really floppy so it ends up kind of flop folding like a tortilla, sides flattening out. If it were stuffed fuller that wouldn't be an issue. :)
review.name: Hauler Tote - great functionality, but floppy!

review.itemreviewed: Del Dia Allpa 30L Gear Hauler Tote
review.reviewBody: Great bag. I’m so happy with this bag but would have like to have more say with the color.
review.name: Great bag

review.itemreviewed: Del Dia Allpa 30L Gear Hauler Tote
review.reviewBody: I have the XL tote (which I love) and came back to buy this one for every day hauling with two small kids. Perfect for a regular outing and more than enough room for everyone's snacks and extras. Doubles as my gym bag too in a pinch. Love the colors!
review.name: Great for every day

review.itemreviewed: Del Dia Allpa 30L Gear Hauler Tote
review.reviewBody: I understand you run the risk of not loving the color combo when all bags are different, but I was hoping for more vibrant, fun colors like depicted in the product photo. Instead, I received a dull olive and brick red color combo. Not nearly as attractive as I wanted.
review.name: Dull Colors

review.itemreviewed: Fire Side Sherpa Full-Zip Jacket - Infants'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This Sherpa gets a five star rating. I purchased this for my one year old child who loves to play outdoors. This has kept her warm while giving her the flexibility to move around and enjoy herself without being restricted. It is made with high quality materials and looks stunning while serving your needs of keeping your child warm. I highly recommend this product and will be purchasing this in other colors.
review.name: Pink Sherpa

review.itemreviewed: Fire Side Sherpa Full-Zip Jacket - Infants'
review.reviewBody: So cozy, super cute on her, but runs at least a half-size small. For size comparison, my kid is 16 months old, 22lbs, still wearing 12M Carters but in 18M Cat&Jack. She’s on the cusp of her 12M Patagonia jacket from last season being too small; the 18M Patagonia I bought this year is too big but will fit all winter. I bought this Columbia one in 12/18M, and it was the perfect length in arms and torso, but it was tight around her toddler belly; she’d have grown out of it in a couple weeks. Exchanged for an 18/24M and it will definitely fit her for the full winter now.
review.name: Perfectly cozy, runs very small

review.itemreviewed: Fire Side Sherpa Full-Zip Jacket - Infants'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So cozy and soft!! The cutest jacket for fall and into winter!
review.name: Love it!

hasVariant.name: Go Series Water Filter 1L Bottle
hasVariant.description: Buy the LifeStraw Go Series Water Filter 1L Bottle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Go Series Water Filter 1L Bottle
hasVariant.description: Buy the LifeStraw Go Series Water Filter 1L Bottle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I purchased a lifestraw go 1lt water bottle after reading all the glowing reviews. I’ve previously used lifestraw while hiking, with no issues and the bottle seemed like a no brainer. What an expensive mistake. The water tastes disgusting. Foul. Plasticky. The water tastes like latex smells. I’m not joking. The first taste made me vomit. And that was after cleaning the bottle, lid, mouthpiece, and prepping the filter as per the instructions. So I cleaned, rinsed, and tried again. Still foul. Still gag worthy. At least I didn’t vomit! Several cleans, rinses, and different water later, and it still tastes foul. Sorry guys, this is a no from me. And these things are EXPENSIVE as here in Australia. A big let down.
review.name: Disgusting taste, like powdery plastic

review.reviewBody: A treat on a recent 3 week visit in Philippines. Tap water, restaurant ice water, all perfectly safe.
review.name: I won't travel without it

review.reviewBody: I was really excited to get my bottle and I am still glad to have it for traveling. However, the resistance is fairly high when sucking directly through the straw that by the end of a day of using it I tend to have a headache. As a result, I am not using it as my daily bottle, only for traveling. The quality is high, it's just impractical for me as a heavy water drinker
review.name: Good quality, hard to drink

review.reviewBody: should have read description before I purchased. wanted to filter ice from machine with drinks of my choice... can't use anything but water in it or it contaminates the filter..money wasted..might not be so bad if it wasn't so hard to draw from straw!
review.name: My Bad

review.reviewBody: I love my water bootle but it has been leaking a lot. I can't lay it on its side or it will leak despite the top being on the lid being tight. It will also leak from the cap when just standing. Works as a filter, I used it all over Ecuador but not really useful for daily because of the leaks
review.name: I would love it, if it didn't leak

review.reviewBody: The straw is very difficult to coax water up. The 5 I bought are pretty much useless. If you leave them for any amount of time they are hard to get going again and it tastes terrible. 4 of these were for children. They got light headed and had sores in their mouths from using these. I am an adult an it is difficult to use and again a few minutes go by and it tastes particularly awful. Had I known all these things I Never would have made such a large purchase and got replacement straws for what turned out to be junk.
review.name: Do not waste your money.

review.reviewBody: This works great! We like to travel and water quality can be hit or miss, whether it’s over-chlorinated hotel tap water or from a sketchy rest stop on the road. This helps us get clean water while we’re on the go!
review.name: Clean water on the go

review.reviewBody: Loving my new Go Series! Never drinking from any other bottle again!
review.name: Clean!

review.reviewBody: We are traveling in Nepal and all of us have gotten giardia because it needs a .1 micron filter and the Lifestraw filters are only .2 so it is worthless overseas. The Sawyer filter is.1 micron though.
review.name: Doesn’t filter Giardia

review.reviewBody: I actually use a zero water filter and this bottle, upgraded(or so I thought) from a standard stainless bottle. One thing I’ve noticed is that after every drink you need to crack the lid and blow into the life straw or the carbon filter will start to stink and taste bad.. a little higher maintenance than expected but I guess it’s still pretty ok.
review.name: Buy extra carbon filters and backwash with lid cracked after every drink.

name: Go Series Water Filter 1L Bottle

hasVariant.description: Buy the Kuat Pivot 2 Swing Away Extension online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've had a Kuat carrier for years but only after putting a topper on my truck did I decide to get a Pivot 2 because my handle bars were hitting the back glass. I always thought it was easy to access my pickup bed but this is much, much better. Love it and would highly recommend. Very easy to install and use.
review.name: Should have bought this year's ago!

review.reviewBody: Needed this to fit my Küat rack on my new 2024 Bronco Raptor.  Driver side swing ensures I can fully open my back window and tailgate.  Thanks for great gear!
review.name: Perfect solution for 2024 Bronco Raptor!

review.reviewBody: I have a Ford Bronco, and previously owned a Jeep Wrangler.  In both cases, the tailgate mounted spare tire and the swing out operation, made it difficult using my hitch mounted bike rack.  I previously had a hitch extension, but while that allowed clearance for the tire, I couldn’t fully open the tailgate.  Enter the Pivot 2.  I saw this on social media and was instantly impressed, mounting to the hitch (much like an extension) and in turn mounting my bike rack to the Pivot 2.  I chose Driver’s side, so (as viewed from the rear of the vehicle) it pivots to the Driver’s side of the vehicle, while my tailgate opens to the passenger side.  I’ve seen a YouTube video of someone using the opposite pivot option and it is still functional, with the Pivot 2 at its fullest position, it clears room for the tailgate in its 90 degree position.  With the Driver’s side, it’s a non issue, so that’s my recommendation.
review.name: Simply amazing

review.reviewBody:
I was looking for a swing away that would work on our Westfalia and while there are many swing away options this was the only one I found that offered the option to swing to the right or left. With the design of our van it's nice to have access to our kitchen in the rear and this swing away allows us to keep the bikes locked to the rack and still have access to the rear of the vehicle. 

Assembly is super easy and only takes a couple minutes. The product is overbuilt and seems like it will last for decades. The only complaint I have with the product is it's a little heavy. Other than that, I would recommend this to anyone who wants a quality swing away they can count on lasting for years.
review.name: Excellent design

review.reviewBody: Like most people, I bought this so I could swing out my loaded bike rack and open the tailgate of my truck. Assembly and installation was quick. I've read a few reviews about issues with the locking mechanism (broken bolts and it not staying in the open position) but I did not experience those problems. My Kuat rack has worked flawlessly for multiple years carrying heavy e-bikes, I expect this swing out to do the same.
review.name: Excellent NV 2.0 A'ccessory

review.reviewBody: This product seemed great, but as soon as I tightened the cam-based mechanism that secures it to the hitch, the whole cam assembly broke in two. If you look at reviews on other sites you'll see many people with the same issue - unfortunately kuat really dropped the ball with the materials they used for the tightening system here.
review.name: Huge design flaw in tightening system

name: Pivot 2 Swing Away Extension

review.reviewBody: This little gem is a sleeper! I was shocked at what a powerful tiny long lasting light it is! Took it camping and all my camping buddies really liked it too. review.reviewBody: I’ve had the Biolite Alpen 500 since it came out, which is still and always will be my fav! But when this little guy came out, I knew I had to have it also. Now it travels with me everywhere I go! It is reliable, easy to use, runs seemingly forever on a charge, has so many lighting options for such a small package, with seriously, the most beautiful vibrant colors, and takes up next to no room in my bag. I loved mine so much i recently purchased a whole pack and gifted them to friends on a weekend getaway. Share the love! Great little lantern!

review.reviewBody:
Listening to stories about other people's feet is boring but the tl;dr of mine is that I've got narrow heels but don't mind a little room in the toe box. Most of the higher-end road shoes have gone super wide due to a vocal market demographic (at least according to what I'm reading on the internets) so I've been trying a bunch recently and wanted to share my experience. 

I was interested to try these Lake shoes because folks were complaining about them being too narrow, which is usually a good sign for me. Comparing them to other shoes I've worn recently (Shimano RC903 - too wide, Spesh S-Works 7 -- great but not made anymore, S-Works Torch -- too wide for me), they were a bit different than I expected. In terms of shape, the fit is pretty excellent, probably on the narrow side and they work pretty well for my feet. They don't offer that extra toe box room that some of the more modern fits offer and honestly I kind of learned to like that in the S-Works 7. Another big difference between the shoes I've listed is the materials. The leather upper is almost patent-leather-glossy, as a result they're super stiff out of the box and not in a good way. Compared to other manufacturer's models using Dynema or similar lightweight synthetics they're way less "foot conforming" and kind of notibably squeak around while riding. I imagine they might soften up over time, but after a couple hundred miles they're still pretty squeaky. Less of a concern but the sole is also some super high gloss carbon, rather than the matte that most modern shoes are using. The result is a little more slippery when walking and a little squeaky against the pedal as well (using SPD-SL cleat that are usually pretty quiet). The BOA dials are nice but pretty much table stakes these days, and they don't get all that tight due to the stiffness of the upper material. BOAs aside, materials-wise they remind me of shoes that were on the market 10-15 years ago, and they're not all that light as a result (esp for a "climbing shoe"). 

The quality seems great but the approach seems antiquated. It would be great to see Lake adapt this fit with more modern materials.
review.name: Great fit, materials could use an update

name: CX302 Narrow Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I'm yet another OG Malamute rider (had my '08 pair for 15 years) who can confirm that they absolutely ruined the design of this boot by changing the liner system. The heel lift is so bad they are simply unrideable and there's nothing you can adjust. I tested them out in the living room and could practically pull my foot out of the boot. Such a shame because I have yet to find another boot that is simultaneously as comfortable and as high-performance as the old Malamutes
review.name: It's as bad as they say

review.reviewBody: I’m happy and comfortable with the boots. I would recommend for people with wide feet.
review.name: Fit well for wide feet

review.reviewBody: I got my first pair of Malamutes in 2004, and last week my fourth pair  (purchased about 2020) had a side seam's stitching rip out, I'm guessing due to flexing rather than rot as I always use a passive dryer on my boots immediately after using them, the same dryer I've been using for about 25 years.  I was planning to go to my local shop to get a new pair, noticed when I googled that there is now both a Boa and the traditional speed pull system I love so much, so I breathed a sigh of relief that the traditional system was still available.  I was glad to know I would not have to use Boas, as I have some arthritis of the hand and I get more than enough twisting of Boas tightening the boots of my younger snowboarding students (I have taught snowboarding (and trained new instructors) 2 to 3 days a week for 20 years.)  I have seen enough broken Boas in the past 15 years to want to steer away from them forever.  I see you sell online now and I chanced to read the current reviews for the speed pull model, which are not good.  It is obvious that in the move to a Boa-dominated economy that you have lost the engineering fine points and quality that made the Malamute the gold standard of snowboard boots.  I really don't want to use Boas, I just want the Malamute with its excellent heel hold harness, liner lock, and speed pull, locking outer laces back, in the quality, performance, and durability levels of the past.  Please go back to the old design soon, or make changes as needed to bring back the excellent levels of performance and reliability of the past.  I was just demonstrating all the great adjustments and design points of my Malamutes to a first-year instructor last week.  Now I will have to tell him what I have found out the last couple of days reading reviews about the current product.  Please note, I wrote this to communicate with you, not the public, so feel free to not publish this on your website, but PLEASE bring your quality and design back - unless I can find a cobbler able to repair my current Malamutes (which are softened up after the 200 or so days I have on them, so I was just going to replace them), I expect I will be buying another company's boots, and I doubt they will match my Malamutes.
review.name: Heartbroken
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: Worst Boots in Saloman History, The lacing system does not work, Boots were made for Boa system, I have broken many laces and plastic clips over 5 weeks, Now Iam being played by Saloman, Do not buy.
review.name: Worst Boots in Salomon history
comment:
Good morning,
Thank you very much for taking the time to share your experience with us.
I regret that this product did not meet your expectations.
If you would like to discuss this further with us, please do not hesitate to contact us by email or telephone.
I have included our contact details below.
https://www.salomon.com/en-gb

review.reviewBody: These boots are absolute trash, broke on day one of last season, warrantied pair I was sent broke on day  one this season before getting off the bus. The warrantied pair they sent were two years old. Would put zero stars if possible. Do Not Buy!
review.name: Break On Day 1
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: Bought these Malamutes a month ago - opening day tomorrow for the big test. Has to be the most comfortable snowboard boot I've ever had. And extremely light. They have a robust tread that holds well on snow when getting from here to there. Love the pull up lacing and it's lace locker up top. Super easy to engage for a nice snug fit, that doeasn't loosen up while riding.
review.name: Great fitting boot!

review.reviewBody: I bought this boot at the start of last winter and was initially impressed with the design. During a season of use I had the eyelets pop out on my while riding multiple times, and the fabric the connects the metal eyelets to the speed lacing system having all nearly worn away. Super dissapointed with what seems like a crucial design flaw. These boots have potential, they rode amazing! Just need to make them last for more then a season…
review.name: Good performance horrible durability
comment: Hi, we are sorry to hear this happened to you. All our products come with a 2-year warranty against material and manufacturing defects. Please contact our customer service so we can check if this is the case, and we will help you set up a claim. Just follow this link: https://www.salomon.com/contact Thank you.

review.reviewBody:
If you are reading this review, you probably rode Malamutes for years because they had an exceptional internal harness system that worked perfectly with the inner liner. Firm ankle hold with no heel lift. Stiff, responsive, and aggressive. Prior to 2021, the Malamute was the best snowboard boot ever made. This is not controversial, there's a booming secondary market for 2020 Malamutes. I would happily pay triple-retail to get a pair of 10.5s.

The 2023 boot is still broken. 
* The internal harness is on the boot, not the liner.
* The liner has too much padding to create a tight fit. This is not a performance liner. 
* The internal harness system maxes out in tightness before becoming tight enough to prevent heel lift. 

I have larger-than-average ankles. If I can't get these tight enough to prevent an *inch* of heel lift, then nobody can. I'm not wearing them too big. I know how to size boots. The design is flawed. If I am getting this much heel lift when the liner is new, it's going to get worse as they pack out. 

Salomon: just go back to the old design. It was perfect. I get that it's cheaper to put the same liner in a bunch of different boots. It's also bad product design. 

The reviews about reliability are also true. I popped an eyelet off the first time laced these up.
review.name: Still not fixed - do not buy
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: First things first, the tread, fit, and lateral stiffness of the boot are all great--if it wasn't for my next and only issue these would be my favorite boots to-date. But unfortunately said issue is durability and is quickly rendering these boots unusable. I've ridden them for 11 days total and they're effectively falling apart. Day 3, one of the top plastic eyelets popped from its screw, thankfully I was able to recover the eyelet and washer and my hillside board shop where I bought the boots put a new screw in it for free same-day. Day 7, one of my speed laces snapped (no, I do not rest the edge of my board on my boot while on the lift) and, again, my board shop came to the rescue and replaced it for free with something similar next-day. Day 11 another plastic eyelet popped and I've been able to recover the eyelet and the screw but not the washer, haven't gone in for repair yet. At this point, these boots need a repair every 3-4 days of riding which is completely unacceptable for a top end boot. After doing a thorough inspection of the boots before this review I'm seeing my other original lace (11 days old) is frayed and ready to snap, 4/6 fabric eyelet binders on right boot and 3/6 fabric eyelet binders on the left boot are frayed and ready to go. For context, I'm 6'1", 200lb, all-mountain rider (have not been able to take these into the back country yet) ride regular in Jones Meteorite bindings on either the Salomon Assassin twin or Jones Stratos directional (bindings and assassin bought at beginning of the season, Stratos and boots bought Jan 27, boots professionally fitted). If you ride consistently week-in week-out like I do then do not buy these boots, at this rate they won't even last half a season.
review.name: Buyer beware: good performance, bad durability
comment: Hi, we are sorry to hear this happened to you. All our products come with a 2-year warranty against material and manufacturing defects. Please contact our customer service so we can check if this is the case, and we will help you set up a claim. Just follow this link: https://www.salomon.com/contact Thank you.

review.reviewBody:
I have been riding Malamute since 1997 or 1998 and this is the first time I consider to look elsewhere for boots. The heal strap doesn't work to fix the heal. I had to return the boots and go back my old ones from 2020. Please go back to the old construction.

Another thing I noticed was that this version wasn't as stiff as the old one.

Please make the 2024 best the GOAT!
review.name: Heal Anker doesn't work

review.reviewBody:
Wore out the first one over about 2years of heavy camping. It’s worked well. Bought the replacement due to accidentally turning on a wrong burner and melted the handle. Love how everything stacks together and packs tightly together.

We have used the pan mostly on the jetboil system but it works well in general for camping/outdoor cooking
review.name: Lightweight, works good for camping

review.reviewBody: Cooks evenly, and the non-stick surface is for real.
The pan’s nonstick coating is no longer after one camping trip use. We used low heat and a nonmetal turner—still a ruined pan. Disappointing.

comment: Thank you for your review. We invite you to call Customer Service for warranty replacement and some tips on use of this item. We may reached at 800-572-8822 M-F between 8am and 4:30 pm EST.

review.reviewBody: Awesome Pan! Pan fried some fish tacos while camping, then eggs and pancakes the next mornings. Simple paper towel wipe was all it took to change between cookings. What else is there to write.
review.name: All you need

review.reviewBody: It's the perfect size and nests so well in the Genesis stove. I made the best tortilla omelette using this pan.
Nice lightweight non-stick pan that even though it's not designed to be used with it, works well with our MiniMo.
review.name: Nice Frying pan

review.reviewBody: Great size for packing with the stove. Fantastic non-stick surface. Very happy with this purchase.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: Fabulous pan to sauté my venison & eggs while I’m out in the woods.
review.name: Impressive

review.reviewBody: I have the regular Jetboil Flash & am still able to use this pan with the pot support. Of course since you can't control/disperse heat the center can get very hot & likely to burn if not careful,  but of courseit still cleans easily.  So I try to keep it to the lowest setting & keep stirring what I'm cooking. I've got to use this 3 times on backpacking trips & each of those times I've used it for reheating purposes. I've made and froze spaghetti, chicken enchiladas & tacos. Using this pan made for delicious 1st night meals. I suggest bringing a piece of foil to use for a lid & helping recirculate the heat.  I fit the pan easily in the bottom section of my Deuter AirContact 55+10, along with my sleeping pad,  sleeping bag, & compressible pillow with the pan going in last covering everything which is nice so the zipper doesn't snag my stuff. I'm hoping to learn to fish/clean & cook using this pan.
review.name: Love this pan

review.reviewBody: So happy I bought ths pan, time for Spring bear season near Denali! Ready to cook some camp meals!
review.name: Great Deal, love this pan!

review.reviewBody:
This is the perfect bag for over night canoe trips. It holds our 2 man tent, two sleeping bags, two inflatable sleeping pads and a change of clothes and we still have room for additional items. We put this dry bag to the real test on our last trip, when a rapid pushed us sideways into a downed tree and caused us to sink our canoe. Everything was submerged underwater but we slept in dry clothes that night! 😂 
The back pack straps also make this really comfortable and easy to carry. Worth every penny!
review.name: Perfect Size

review.reviewBody: I gave this bag a try on a multi-day canoe trip in the BWCA.  It's a well-made, high-capacity, backpack style dry-bag.  It's simple, seems durable, and sits nicely in a canoe.  But it is NOT a good fit for carrying across longer portages.  It has no waist belt to help bear the load, very little padding on the shoulder straps, and no structure or padding of any kind against your back.  It might be perfect for carrying a few yards from your boat to a shoreline campsite, but it's painful on days with multiple 100+ rod portages.
review.name: Not great for long portages

name: Bill's Bag 65-110L Dry Bag

hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Shield 13L Pannier online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: took these on a 2 week bikepacking trip. despite bumping all around on gravel and road, they hung on like champs. highly recommend, and easy to install on the Thule Tour Rack.
review.name: took these suckers cross country

review.reviewBody: I use these a couple times a week on my commute to work. Even though they are small, one pannier is just the right size to fit my lunch and a change of clothes. The internal mesh pockets are nice to hold my wallet and other small items. The attachment mechanism is very easy to adjust and so easy to take on and off the rack. For reference, I am using them on a cyclocross bike with the Axiom Streamliner Disc DLX rack. I have more than enough heel clearance since the bags are small and the rack puts them further rearward. The panniers are well built and feel heavy duty. Can't wait to use them for bikepacking trips and picnics with my wife.
review.name: Awesome commuter panniers

review.reviewBody: I've been using these daily since they arrived, they're not huge but still fit a lot without being really heavy or bulky. Even using one at a time is great for short day-trips. The attachment mechanism is incredible and so easy to use.
review.name: Great for everyday

review.reviewBody:
Use these on my Salsa Warbird with Wanderlust rack.  I've used them for long rides (Recently up Mt. Evans), or around town for pack-mule-ing my wife and my locks, cables, a rain jackets.  Also great to have on to pick up produce or a 6 packs :)

I do almost all my riding on gravel.... very secure attachment.  Top attachment points can be adjusted narrower/wider to perfectly fit the rack and prevent forward/backward movement.  Adjustable rotating latch on the bottom prevents tipping away from the rack when cornering / windy days / bumps, etc.  Nice organizational mesh pockets on the interior.  As someone who always stays out later than planned and I forget my lights..... I also love the reflectivity!
review.name: Nice Panniers!

name: Shield 13L Pannier

review.itemreviewed: Kaci III Winter Slip-On Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love my new Winter Slip-ons! They’re just what I need to take our 2 puppies outside or get the mail. The sole is nubby enough to keep me safe in snow. Easy on, easy off, and so rugged and comfy. I’m a new Keen fan!
review.name: Comfy slip-ons!

review.itemreviewed: Kaci III Winter Slip-On Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Loved the shoe, but because I have inserts, I ordered a size up. Big mistake! I'll be sending them back and ordering only a half size different from my normal shoe size. I was told by a pedorthist that sneakers are to be ordered 1 size up but often regular shoes should only be 1/2 size up. Good to know!
review.name: Shoe too big for me

review.itemreviewed: Kaci III Winter Slip-On Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: THis is my 8th pair of Keens. THese are nothing like any other Keens. I wear a 7 in all other Keens, a 6. 5 in other brands. These were bigger then others. They also do not have the wide toe box of my older Kacis. I placed Keen inserts in, which helped with the looseness but the heal is too shallow, my foot slips out with each step. I absolutely love my old Kacis but wanted a black pair. These are made nothing like the older pair and hurt my feet in ways no keens ever have including composite toe work keens. Im sooo disappointed. My partner order these for my birthday. we will be returning. Now I dont trust my beloved keens.
review.name: Nothing like old Kacis or other keens

review.itemreviewed: Kaci III Winter Slip-On Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love these shoes. They fit great and verrrry comfortable. I have flat feet and really need the support in my arches. I normally wear a 6 but bought a 6 -1/2 thinking I may need room for socks in the winter. I had to send them back and get the 6, they seem true to size. Keens, were great to work with a speedy return and replacement at the same price. Keens ALWAYS give me the fit and best comfort. This is my 5th pair I've owned and when I'm ready to replace my tennis shoes, I'm going to look at Keens. My husband just purchased his 3rd and 4th pair, he's sold on them too! I have recommended them to all my friends.
review.name: Perfect fit and Absolute Comfort

review.itemreviewed: Kaci III Winter Slip-On Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am transitioning to slip on shoes and needed one for three seasons. I own many Keen shoes/boots and think they are the best. I have many problems with my back, left ankle and feet. Keens are about the only shoe I can wear so obviously they work for all my problems. The roomy space, comfort, fit and warmth are perfect for me. There’s no guessing the size because it seems to be consistent. Love these as I do the others! Easy online ordering and quick delivery!
review.name: Another perfect shoe

review.itemreviewed: Kaci III Winter Slip-On Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Roomy for my toes, sturdy for all day comfort at work and great for long walks over all kinds of terrain. I just wish the company would bring back the Kacis with a little more design such as a cute buckle or such.
review.name: No achy feet or legs

review.itemreviewed: Kaci III Winter Slip-On Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Thought this was more like a slip on style. A lower back that doesn't require a shoe horn to get on. So am disappointed, but a firm believer in Keens. Only brand I wear year round!
review.name: Thought this was more like

review.itemreviewed: Kaci III Winter Slip-On Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These shoes were comfortable from the start. No break-in period. Absolutely love them! And they are warm which is an extra plus.
review.name: Shoes for the Dacks

review.itemreviewed: Kaci III Winter Slip-On Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is my 3rd pair of these shoes. I love them and my feet love them. Perfect fit, comfortable for work to walk and stand in. My only wish is that they would be made in more colors!!
review.name: Kaci III Winter Slip On my #1

review.reviewBody:
This bag looks good and the storage/compartments are designed well. I’ve taken it on several trips now and am happy with the amount in holds, the layout of the sections, and the features it has. 
The only thing that prevents this bag from being perfect for me are the shoulder straps. I chose a bag without a chest strap because I was not looking for a hiking backpack, and wanted something that looked a bit nicer. However, the shoulder straps feel as if they are constantly sliding off of my shoulders. I regularly have to pull them back on so the bag doesn’t slip down onto my arms.
review.name: Very good (almost great) bag

review.reviewBody: I often longboard around campus at my college, and one night, while I was riding back to my dorm room, I hit a pothole and fell off my board. I landed the backpack and slid on the asphalt for 8 to 10ft, after getting up, it looked like it barely took any damage, it also protected my laptop, which I keep in it as well. It is well made and durable, I have yet to run into an issue that I can't get over.
review.name: Extremely durable

review.reviewBody:
Bought in Tromsø.
It's my favorite for our family's adventures.
Rigid back. 
Makes your loads, light.
Fantastic.
review.name: Bought in Tromsø

review.reviewBody: Great materials and organization, was too small to fit me right (52cm torso) but fit my girlfriends shorter torso length perfectly. I Also wish the water bottle pocket pocket was a stretchier material as right now it can't be used when the bag is fully packed out.
review.name: Great bag for shorter torso lengths.

review.reviewBody: Bought this around April2023 for the look and lightweight comfort, and expect the G1000 to be very durable. However, in less than a year the edge at the lower back started to discolour and eventually broken. I suspect the fabric folded out at the lower edge creates a weak spot for abrasion with the lower back. I did not rewax the bag but I suspect one has to rewax that part rather frequently to avoid damage. I sincerely hope Fjallraven could make the fabric flat and add reinforce on that part like other hiking pack brands as it is such a beautiful looking bag. Don’t understand why the Skule got it right but not the Raven.
review.name: Design flaw: weak spot for abrasion at lower back

review.reviewBody: Would be a 5-star if the bag included a sternum strap.
review.name: 4/5 star backpack

review.reviewBody: It’s so cute very perfect for a college or school bag. it fits my laptop, ipad, hydro flask, folder, binder, and a few notebooks. it’s super compact and so cute. I’m in love with my bag and so glad i was able to get one.
review.name: Perfect school bag

review.reviewBody: I first received the Raven 20 in Dusk as a gift four years ago. I fell in love — lightweight, durable, great style. It was never completely waterproof, even after several layers of wax, but its trim profile and capacious organization made it feel like a bag both smaller and larger than its size. I used it everyday for two years, until it developed a tear on the bottom, where the G-1000 failed; other reviewers have posted photos similar to what happened on mine. Fjallraven did a warranty repair, and the bottom lasted for two more years of travel, hiking, bike commuting, and photography work until it ripped again. The real problem, however, was the zipper on the smaller of the two large compartments kinked and then unthreaded from the bag. Support mentioned that a repair of this nature would be incredibly difficult to fix, and were generous enough to offer me a replacement Raven 20 in the new style. This new bag feels just as robust, and the mesh backer is a nice change from the previous model’s standard fabric. I miss my old style bag, but I’m hopeful this new one will take me on as many adventures, though hopefully for more than just 4 years. Still, huge thanks to the Fjallraven support team. This is still my magic bag.
review.name: 4+ years of magic

review.reviewBody: I searched for a backpack and tried out many different ones from the Patagonia black hole to the north face borealis and I landed on this bag. It is fantastic for grad school with perfect balance between storage and organization for everything. Perfect padded area for laptop and iPad, with solid room for a notebook and some folders or a jacket/packing cube. Great secondary pocket for organization with calculator and pen bags and journals. 10/10!
review.name: Perfect for students

review.reviewBody:
I purchased this bag a few months ago, in patina green, specifically for our day in Tikal, Petén, Guatemala and it did not disappoint. It had the perfect amount of pockets for pens, personal toiletries, extra battery packs, tripod, protein bars, water bottle, sun block, rain jacket, small towel, and other must have “in case of” items.
The two main compartments go deep for additional items, which I like to organize with packing cubes.
The backpack has now been upgraded as my travel back pack and it will also double as my work lap top back pack.
Reason for the 4 stars? Fjallraven absolutely needs to add a carry on sleeve. We traveled with a carry on and the bag got a bit heavy at times, I wish I could have set it down on the carry on. Thankfully, the craftsmanship makes it easy to carry with heavier items. I am barely at 5ft, and this bag fit perfect on my frame.
It would also be nice to see additional options to clip on carabiners, water bottles or your phone, built into the front of the straps.
review.name: Perfect for travel, hikes and EDC!

name: Raven 20L Backpack

hasVariant.description: Buy the Nikwax Tent & Gear Solar Proof Concentrate online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I have used solar proof for the last 2 years on my backpacking tent. My little tent was already 7 years old and it was not leaking and I didn't want it to start. My experience has been on a couple hundred nites on the AT & CDT with plenty of rain.

Finding the concentrate is great. Now I mix my own in the old 17oz spray bottle. 5 oz of concentrate and then fill w water. Big money saver.

 I would solar proof my rain fly and the bottom of my tent. It was always adequate on the rain fly and it works on the bottom but it wears off faster there, so i tent sealed the interior floor most recently. I have also used it on my cycling tent which is a hubba hubba and it got old and I have reseam sealed it and I use solarproof every year on the rainfly. So far my tent is waterproof. I can feel the difference on the tent. It feels brand new and slippery again after I'm done. 
This is an easy product to apply on a damp tent. Just have a dry rag handy to spread it around and make sure there's not pools and drips of it and then you let it dry while the tent is set up.
review.name: extending a tents life

review.reviewBody: I have a tent that is ~9 years old and in excellent condition (no tears, no rips, clean inside and out, always put away bone dry and stored in a cool place). Unfortunately, water had started leaking through the rain fly. I'm not talking about through the seams, I'm talking about through the sidewall fabric. I mixed up this concentrated Nikwax Solarproof up according to the directions and have tried applying this to the underside of the fly and outer side of the fly. I have tried applying it to the fly when dry, when wet, by spraying it on, by rubbing it in with my hand... nothing works. In fact, when applying this to the outside of the rain fly, whether by hand or spray, it actually leaks through the fly, resulting in drips on the inside of the fly that I have to wipe down as well. Maybe this would work in extending the life of a good rain fly, I haven't tested that, but in terms of breathing new life into a rainfly that already leaks - don't waste your money - I already wasted mine and am writing this review to save yours.
review.name: Garbage for re-waterproofing tent

name: Tent & Gear Solar Proof Concentrate

review.reviewBody: Expected a little more comfort but they do the trick and look pretty good too.
review.name: Rugged and functional.

review.reviewBody: I?m OBSESSED with the dress boot. I have a pair of the 550?s in Crazy Horse and love them, but I wanted a slightly more versatile pair of Blundstones for my black boots. The dress boot is super comfortable and flattering, and is not as clunky as the regular styles. These boots can easily be worn with both a dress or jeans. If you can only buy one pair of Blundstones, these are a great option for versatility. This style does run a full size larger than other Blundstone styles (I wear a U.S. 7/AUS 4 in 550?s and a U.S. 6/AUS 3 in the dress boot).
review.name: Beautiful Versatile Boot, Runs Large

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of Blundstones and I am so happy with them! They?re incredibly comfortable and I can tell they?ll last for years. The first pair I owned, I got in a 4.5 (7.5 US) and they fit a little tight at first but now they fit like a glove. The dress boots do run fairly large in my opinion. I originally ordered a 4.5 but had to size down a couple of times and ended up with a 3.5 (6.5 US) and am so happy I did! The Backcountry customer support was amazing and so helpful every time I called for an exchange. I?m only putting 4 stars because I had to exchange twice but it was never a bad experience. Get these boots!
review.name: love these!

review.reviewBody: These felt great from the moment I slipped them on. I ordered the Rustic black, looks exactly like the photo. The toe is more square which is what gives it the dressier look. The thing I love about them is you can dress them up or dress them down making them THE perfect fall boot. Super comfy. Super sturdy. 10/10 would recommend.
review.name: Great dress/casual boot

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit and feel right out of the box. These boots are stylish, comfortable, and boast high quality craftsmanship. They are true to size - I normally wear a Women's 8 in boots and casual shoes and I ordered an 8 (US size) in these. They are a perfect fit. Highly recommend for a functional, yet stylish footwear choice!

review.reviewBody:
There’s so much to love about these! Water resistant, stretchy fabric, corded ankle, fit is perfect. Absolutely worth the money. They are so comfortable. I may purchase one in every color! 
I’m 5’4”, 120# and got the XS.
review.name: Subi Pant XS

review.reviewBody: I usually between M and L. I got another pans Salto size M and was enough space, but this Subo pant is tight.
review.name: Good quality pant

review.reviewBody: These pants are well constructed, and the material feels really nice. If you fall within the size measurements, I would 100% recommend them. My only complaint is that they only have 1 back pocket - and you will not be able to get your phone in there. However, I wasn’t able to test them in the long run. I had to return them because these pants ARE true to size / size guide is correct for the XS. But there’s no XXS option :( I thought I’d give them a try anyway, but as someone with very narrow hips (31”), these are way too roomy in that area and it looks like you’re wearing some sort of balloon pants. If you do have regular/wider hips, they would be extremely cute. But I wish these were offered in more inclusive sizing.
review.name: Awesome pants, but too few sizes

review.reviewBody:
I love these pants. I’m only 5’2” and have a very short waist and big hips so finding pants is difficult. These pants fit and look amazing. 
I’m so glad I took a chance and went in to try them on.
review.name: Great pants!

review.reviewBody: It is comfy and breathable; I loved the color I chose. I bought it one size up beacuse I wouldn't say I like tight clothing for hiking. However, it doesn't feel oversized.
review.name: I love the color and material!

review.name: Perfect pants, comfortable, easy washing,

review.name: I like the material used

review.reviewBody: Love these! The color, material, and flexibility are perfect. I have wider hips for my size, but the small was still good for me. I do a lot of hiking and climbing, these will be perfect for both!

review.itemreviewed: Breeze Sleeping Bag Liner + Insect Shield
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] High quality packaging design. Very comfortable material used in the manufacturing. It's very durable and should last a very long time. Very easy to unpack and setup. It does a great job of helping defend you against insects.
review.name: Very durable and high quality

review.itemreviewed: Breeze Sleeping Bag Liner + Insect Shield
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wow this mummy shield bag liner is amazing! Works excellently to keep out pests, smooth fabric keeps you cool at night and when it's humid. Strong and durable, very lightweight and packs up small and is easy to carry.
review.name: A must have for your summer camping needs

review.itemreviewed: Breeze Sleeping Bag Liner + Insect Shield
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The product is Lightweight comfy pad, gives a great night's sleep.
Pros
• Lightweight
• Comfortable
• Easy and quick to inflate/deflate
• Packs down 

Cons
• A bit noisy on the tent floor
• The "bleed" valve is a little fussy at  times
review.name: Good for try

review.itemreviewed: Breeze Sleeping Bag Liner + Insect Shield
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I went car camping this weekend and it was amazing! So small and compact and also kept me so warm. Easy to pack and use and very comfortable. I loved the product!
review.name: Just like the photo!

review.itemreviewed: Breeze Sleeping Bag Liner + Insect Shield
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This liner is very comfortable and easy to wash.  I like the material and the insect protector it very nice . It is easy to pack 
And unpack. It's very lightweight and durable!
review.name: I like the material and insect protector

review.itemreviewed: Breeze Sleeping Bag Liner + Insect Shield
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Though I haven't used it for a full cold weather camping night yet, I can tell this material will do very well in a sleeping bag. It is soft and frictionless, making it very comfortable even against bare skin. It is also moisture wicking and dries very fast, which is nice for this type of application. Since I own some pretty pricey sleeping bags, I'm happy to have this liner to help preserve and protect them. It is very well made and a great design. Folds into a very compact bag for travel and storage
review.name: Well thought out design. Great material

review.itemreviewed: Breeze Sleeping Bag Liner + Insect Shield
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag liner is a handy thing. It's thin and soft. Large enough for my almost 6ft  husband to fit into with room the spare. This would be good to have for almost any season camping.
review.name: Handy

review.itemreviewed: Breeze Sleeping Bag Liner + Insect Shield
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] While this is a liner for a sleeping bag I would definitely use it on its own in the summer where I am because it can get hot camping. The fabric is made to be cool wicking and the fiber is woven with the tencel to keep away mosquitoes. The liner can withstand about 30 washes for it still to be effective against bug repelling. I will only wash it a couple times a season so it should last quite a few seasons. I have a different brand mummy bag and the liner still fits inside nice. I also like that the bottom has a draw cord so I can easily wear it around the fire at the campsite. Both myself at 5'3 and my husband at 6'1 can fit into this liner comfortably. I am very excited to use this liner all season while camping. So far no bug bites after one night of use. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest review.
review.name: Great bug repellent liner

review.itemreviewed: Breeze Sleeping Bag Liner + Insect Shield
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] If you travel a lot and camp outdoors this is a game changer! It truly does keep out insects and is super comfortable. You can easily wash it and it’s super durable.
review.name: A must have

review.itemreviewed: Breeze Sleeping Bag Liner + Insect Shield
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] soooo excited to recieve this from Influenster! I needed this for my backpacking setup!! I love the sea to summit brand & am so excited to continue to use this liner in my future camping trips. Comfortable & will be good for the slightly warmer weather. Great quality!!
review.name: YAY love it

name: Breeze Sleeping Bag Liner + Insect Shield

review.reviewBody:
I am making my second trip up Denali this spring.  Last trip I used my Spantiks.  I love those boots, but they do not keep my feet warm, as I have some circulation issues.  This go around the decision to go with an 8000 meter boot was an easy one and since I've never had fit issues with Sportiva, the new Oly Mons Cube was what I purchased.  Out of the box - they are beautiful boots!  Everything about them appears to be extremely well done and the quality appears to be off the charts..........until you put them on and start climbing!!!!  The outer shell crushes my upper ankle / lower shin on both feet.  It is so apparent and painful that I find it hard to believe that LaSportiva is not racing to fix this issue!!!  There is absolutely no way I could survive 20 days on Denali with these boots.  I don't know if it's a liner issue or an outer shell issue but right where the boots flexes - right where my ankle flexes is like there is a hard, plastic pipe around my ankle and every step you feel this think flex hard against my ankle.  

As is mentioned in the other reviews, I will try my Spantik liners or Intuition Liners.  Very dissapointing for a $1200.00 boot!!
review.name: What Was LaSportiva Thinking??!!

review.reviewBody:
A quick note on fitting crampons with the ski tech inserts on these boots.  I couldn't find much info on pairing crampons with these elsewhere on the internet.  

The ski tech inserts make the front toe bails very wide, so they don't fit most semi-automatic crampons.  I bought these boots in a 48 (admittedly a large boot) and only found one semi-automatic crampon that fit reliably: the Grivel G-12 with the cramp-o-matic bindings.  The BD Sabretooths, Petzl Vasaks, and Grivel G14s with the New-Matic bindings did not fit.  The poor fit was not a length issue.  

Automatic crampons seemed to fit a little better.  The Petzl Sarkens with the wire toe bail and the Camp Alpinists both had wide enough toe bails to accommodate the ski tech bindings.  But I prefer semi-automatic crampons for less technical glaciated mountains where I'm doing more uphill walking and not climbing vertical ice.

If you want to avoid the issue altogether and won't use the boots for skiing, I'd buy the Olympus Mons Cube S.  The "S" version doesn't have the ski tech inserts.  (Absolutely no clue why Sportiva labeled the non-ski version with an "S.")

Other than the crampon issue, these are great, though I agree with other reviews about the liners.  They have a weird fold at the top that rubs your shins when you aren't wearing over-the-calf mountaineering socks.  Liners from the Spantiks solve the issue.

As far as fit goes, I wear a 13 street shoe and a 47 in the Sportiva Trango Tower Extremes, which I fit a bit tighter for ice climbing.  The 48 gave me some extra room to wiggle my toes, but it didn't feel too loose.
review.name: Crampon Advice

review.reviewBody:
Summary - The best 8000m boot out there, but be ready to buy alternative liners.

I purchased the Oly Mons Cube for Everest and tested them out this weekend in the White Mountains doing 17 miles and 9000 ft elevation gain. Comfy, warm and light boot around my feet but they ripped my shins apart. My shins were in severe pain, plus were blistered and bleeding requiring considerable time out of the boot to recover. It was the liners. I am extremely disappointed in their liners and I wouldn't survive a few days wearing these on Everest, and not what you would expect from a $1200 boot!

I have a pair of Spantiks I used to climb Denali (which are comfy btw, but not suitable for Everest). I dropped in my Spantik liner, they are way comfier with the Oly Mons Cube and make a great replacement. The tongue at the front°of the liner is the key (no tongue on the Oly Mons Cube liner), it stops all the chaffing.  I hear from a guide friend the Baruntse liner also works well, or even better replace with an intuition liner with a tongue.

I am a size 12 US, and always go up a size (bought size 47 / US 13) in all my La Sportiva boots.
review.name: Amazing boots, terrible liners!
comment:
I have the same issue,  tried them out (it's cold here in the Chicago area) and these liners are brutal on the shins.  Planning on Everest in April/May.   You find a good liner for these boots suitable for Everest?  Was gonna check out Intuition liners. 

Clyde
I agree with you.  I have the same issue.  Used Mons on Denali and it was the biggest mistake of my life.

review.reviewBody:
These boots have been through the ringer!!! From climbing in Nepal and Mt. Everest to mountaineering expeditions and ice climbing trips in Alaska, these boots hold up. Super comfy after you break them in, and my feet have NEVER been cold with these guys. Super insulated. I'll be using these boots until they fall apart.

(Photo: Sukakpak Visuals)
review.name: Perfect for those cold days
comment: nice photos! what about the sizing? what are your street shoe size and what size did you get in these boots?

review.reviewBody:
When I heard the Olympus Mons were being updated with the boa system it wasn't even a question of if I wanted to try them, but whether I could get a pair before leaving for Nepal this season. They arrived soon after their release but just before the Everest season was canceled...and so the boots sat in their box likely due to the disappointment that all my gear packed would now be set aside for adventures on a date unknown.

Yesterday though I couldn't hold off trying them on any longer and they are everything and more I could have hoped for. This is of course a review based on never having them outside my quarantined home, but I have never tried on a mountaineering boot and had them be this comfortable right out of the box. Light, nimble feeling on the mountain, I think I may have done a happy dance in them after getting them on. The boa system is a game changer as for years frozen fingers and trying to tie up my boots has been a struggle I never looked forward to, but that is gone. 

But it is not just the boa system. The zipper securely runs the foot and along up the calf in a way which feels like it keeps the boot more flush to your leg and physically follows a natural line. The inner boot begins with a slipper like sock that then slips into the inner boot. Both feel an improvement upon the previous design. 

Everything about this boot makes me happy and of course will know more once I am on the mountain with them, but my initial love is deep and ever devoted. Worth every dollar and more.
review.name: Worth The Wait & Can Hardly Wait To Use!

name: Olympus Mons Cube Mountaineering Boot
