review.reviewBody: I personally love this shoe. It is comfortable, easy to slip on and worked great in multiple types of climbing. Definitely am going to get these again.
review.name: Great All-Round Shoe!

review.reviewBody:
The women's version of this shoe fits really well. It's comfortable and supportive and offers the benefits of both a stiff and soft shoe. I am able to confidently use it on small and awkward foot holds, but I trust it just as much on volumes and smearing!

I do wish the heel kept its shape and fit after several months of wear. I've found that the heel loosens slightly. While it doesn't loosen to the point to where they're no longer effective, I personally think it loosens enough to lose some confidence when heel hooking smaller holds. I understand the shoe will stretch over time, but I downsized considerably so there shouldn't be any excuse for them to not fit well especially as a guy wearing the women's versions which is supposed to be lower volume.

Overall, I am more than satisfied with the shoe. I think if you're looking to get a pair of shoes that does an all around great job at everything, this is the shoe.
review.name: The Almost Perfect Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody:
The skwamas are very comfortable, fit my heels well. My friend suggested the solutions but these were a much better fit for me with a smaller heel and a bit of a wider foot. Smears well, Great for tiny edges, heel and toe hooks.
I use them for bouldering, sport and gym.
The only problem is that they de laminated after 2 weeks and I am not one to ruin or go through climbing shoes quickly. I was told that it was common for these shoes. Its too bad because they feel great and I love them. but considering the durability I would not get them again.
review.name: delaminates

review.reviewBody: Neil Gresham, Adrian Baxter and Stu Littlefair chat about the latest La Sportiva's climbing innovation, the  "S-Heel technology" found on the new Skwama and Otaki shoes: Check out their thoughts in this first complete product review, during a recent trip to the Peak District with Dark Sky Media.
review.name: La Sportiva Skwama product video

review.reviewBody: Great shoe! I wear them for bouldering since it's a bit aggressive. :)
review.name: Great shoe!

review.reviewBody: The Women's Skwama has to be my favourite all-round shoe. I use this shoe for bouldering, sport climbing, trad climbing and training in the gym. I find it performs all all arenas. The only time I don't favour it is on vertical, technical climbing when I want a bit of a stiffer shoe. It's comfortable and the strap allows me to snug it up tight so that the heel stays on with heel hooks. If you're looking for a Jack (or Jill!) of all trades, this is the shoe for you!
review.name: My Favourite Shoe

review.reviewBody: These shoes are a softer, lighter version of the solutions. I have narrow feet and a very narrow heel- these fit perfectly. I couldn’t be happier.
review.name: Skwama love

review.reviewBody: This has been my go-to shoe for all of 2019. I'm not normally one for the women's specific shoes, but this one fits everything so perfectly. It's soft enough to feel the tiniest edge, yet aggressive enough to help you swim through the Madness Cave at the RRG. It's easy on and off velcro makes it a great shoe for bouldering or sport climbing.
review.name: Best all around shoe!

review.reviewBody: I have been wearing the women's skwamas since they were released and they are my hands-down go to for EVERYTHING (bouldering, routes, gym). They are soft enough to be sensitive on the rock, but stiff enough mid-sole for aggressive climbing.
review.name: All-around favorite climbing shoe

review.reviewBody: The women's Skwama is my go-to shoe for almost all terrains and styles of climbing. From steep bouldering to technical smears to gym climbing, the Skwama is my #1 choice. The Skwama fits my narrow foot and heal, which is a tough find for me. With a flexible midsole but slightly stiffer toe, the Skwama allows me to edge precisely AND pull with my toes. It's also a super comfy shoe, so my feet are happy during long days out climbing or long training sessions in the gym.
review.name: My #1 Go-To

review.reviewBody: I noticed the 1-star review and normally don't leave reviews but felt compelled.  I too have been actively riding for 25+ years and can confidently say these are some of the best compression shorts I have worn.  The seemless legs are super comfortable and stay in place.  There are no bulky seams and the padding is top notch.  From my experience, this is where you notice cheaper shorts the most...bulky uncomfortable, this or stiff pads.  These disappear which is why you get what you pay for.  Lastly, they are made to fit snug and fit true to size.  I wear the same size in these as all other compression shorts.
review.name: Best Short I have ever worn

Size is small for a medium
Material doesn't breath at all
Ride comfort is no better than shorts costing half as much

Will stick to lower priced shorts in the future

review.name: Great Little Pack

review.reviewBody: Fantastic pack. Perfect amount of space for a day wading trip. Being from Michigan we will typically change presentations throughout the day. Drys in the morning, nymphs and streamers through the day, and big drys or even mice at night. I like a pack that I can carry everything I need for the day but also a pack that’s not to big or bulky. Easy access to everything needed. Seems like the bigger the pack, the more we carry that’s unneeded. Another great feature is the multiple different ways this pack can be worn. I love packs that have the ability to connect direct to your wader straps
review.name: Freestone Chest Pack

review.reviewBody: Love the size and amount of storage for minimalist gear needs. Would gladly give it 5 star except that the zipper on the workstation/fly garage section ALWAYS catches on material inside the compartment when trying to unzip, which results in a necessary 2 handed tug of war to get it opened. Really frustrating for sure. Also the elastic on the floatant velcro is not adjustable so not every bottle will stay firmly held.
review.name: Would love to give this 5 stars

name: Freestone Chest Pack

review.reviewBody: I have two other pair of Hokas that fit perfect. These are too narrow. They pinch the side of my feet so I can't wear them for long periods of time without being uncomfortable.
review.name: Too narrow

review.reviewBody: Although I sound like a squeaking duck when I walk on concrete, I have finally found the right shoe for my foot! Love the support, the width, and the slip in. Everyone's foot is different, but these worked for me! I need HOKA to add more neutral colors!!!
review.name: Love

review.reviewBody: Having recently tried several new different styles of Hokas (after wearing several styles for a few years) I haven't been able to find a good fit. Some of the toe boxes are too narrow on te third and fourth toes, and too low. So disappointing. Others slip badly in the heel.
review.name: Sizing inconsistent

review.reviewBody: I purchased two pairs of this shoe because initially I thought they fit great. The first pair, which I will still keep, started causing some pain on the outside of my little toe after a week of wear. Aside from that I liked it, but I decided to return the unused backup pair. Somehow the return label process doesn't work (I just did another return for my husbands sneakers no problem this week) and I cannot print the label. After going in twice to try and generate it again their site has now blocked me. So don't plan on a smooth return process if your shoes don't fit. :/
review.name: The shoe caused foot pain and Awful return process

review.reviewBody: I was completely in love with these shoes, until I put them on and went out for a brief walk / hike. Absolutely killed my feet and ended up with blisters on my heels. I returned them literally the day after. It's a shame because I was completely in love with them at first glance. Definitely size up, and if you have a wider foot, steer clear.
review.name: Beautiful, but absolutely murdered my feet.

review.reviewBody: These shoes were advertised as step in shoes, they aren't, I was very disappointed.
review.name: I had to return these shoes.

review.reviewBody: I had to return my shoes for a half size larger. I've never worn a 9.5 size shoe. I like the shoe except the color is not the color shown. On email it looks like a brown leather. It looks more like a pink color. I don't care for the color as I thought it was a brown!!!
review.name: Color not as shown!

review.reviewBody: These are fantastic - super comfortable and super easy to slip on and stay on!
review.name: Love these shoes!

review.reviewBody: Bought these for a road trip through three national parks. I only wore them for about an hour ahead of the trip to break them in. Didn't need a breaking in period at all! These shoes were very comfortable, had no pain, blisters, or anything when without a breaking in period. Provided great stability on rocky and uneven trails in the mountain. The traction was great and felt super grippy. I also enjoy how light the shoes are - makes the longer hikes that much more enjoyable. Can't wait to wear these on more hikes! Only complaint is the integrated tongue. Wish it had more give to loosen the laces as the top of the shoe felt a bit tight at time.
review.name: could not be more impressed

review.reviewBody: While the step in function is great, the stitched down tongue is NOT. The ridge that the stitching forms hits over the instep and causes pressure pain within an hour of putting them on, walking or not. I loved the high heel support but just can't wear these! Not comfortable .
review.name: I wanted so much to like these!

name: Anacapa 2 Freedom Hiking Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: They are comfortable, slimming and most importantly they're warm.
review.name: A Great Fit!

review.reviewBody: Size up for sure, the insulation in the pants makes them tight in the hips/thighs. I sadly found out how inconvenient that was while I was already wearing them out on the slopes when I realized I couldn't get into my pockets, so I can't exchange for a larger size. Also I already put a tear in the inner boot reinforced fabric after 2 wears so that's cool!!
review.name: Size Up

review.reviewBody: Love the off white/ cream color. Super fashionable and functional! Not too baggy, has a nice fit.
review.name: Love the color!!! Cute and functional

review.reviewBody: I saw in some reviews that people said they fit small. I always comfortably fit into a size small across all brands so I figured I'd be fine. Definitely not the case! I'm hoping I can exchange them.
review.name: Definitely size up!!

review.reviewBody: It was warm, insulated, but not to the point I was sweating. I sized up, expecting them to be baggy, but I was humbled as they fit perfect. North Face's large is a big smaller than your classic large
review.name: Super Cute for the Mountains

review.reviewBody: I needed a pair of snow bibs that could with stand harsh Idaho winters, these were recommended to me by a friend and seemed like a great option! For a taller person the long style fits great and doesn't ride up my shins. I rated this 4 stars instead of 5 because I haven't tested them this season yet.
review.name: Great Fit

review.reviewBody: These fit perfect and feel great. They are quite warm and have pockets in all the places needed. The option to get them "long" is very nice to make sure they fit all the way down boots.
review.name: So cute

review.reviewBody: Warm and comfortable. Sizing correct but I ordered a size larger for warmer clothes to fit under during snow storms.
review.name: Comfy and warm

review.reviewBody: These fit great. I was nervous about the length but it's just perfect. Can't wait to try them out in the mountain!
review.name: 5 Stars ⭐️

review.reviewBody: Purchased a L in the short bibs as a 5'8 male, 32" waist. I wanted a bib with a less-baggy look and these work well. Haven't been out in 'em yet but quality seems good. Detachable straps would be nice, though.
review.name: Good fit for men, too.

review.reviewBody:
The good: Geo and overall ride quality are fantastic on this bike. Sharp steering but, also feels stable while descending.  Lovely paint scheme, and the gold matches tan side walls spectacularly.

The bad: Getting the steerer shim in feels bad. The tolerance is far too tight. Following their online instructions to use carbon paste, and then push it in works... but it's never coming out. It's a very snugg fit and, it made properly preloading the headset a headache.

I don't mind integrated cables and the extra faff when replacing a headset, but I fear I won't be able to remove mine with out rerunning all new hydraulic lines, because they'll get crushed and damaged when attempting to take the bars off.

I also wish it had a little more tire/rim clearance. I can't use my hunt limitless wheels on it because there's not sufficient clearance for them.
review.name: Great ride with some bad designs

review.reviewBody: Sold my old Fast Noah when another very popular aero road bike was available via a race team I was riding for. I no longer race and enjoy doing fast group rides & having fun. Wanted a second bike that was unique, fast, and held its own against more recognized brands. Standard Noah was only 100 grams heavier than the Fast,  With the frame savings I purchased higher-end components and wheels, which more than made up for the weight difference. It seems every bit as fast as my popular aero bike and is nearly 2 lbs lighter. The stiff frame 25mm tires gives a rather harsh ride, switching to 28mm tires made a huge difference, with no loss in speed. The bike performs every bit as well a most of the expensive super bikes out there while costing thousands less...it simply works as advertised
review.name: It simply works

name: Noah Disc Frameset

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, super comfy, I’m strictly a sport climber but I hike quite a bit to get to the slab. Works great.
review.name: Lightweight.

review.reviewBody: I'm absolutely thrilled with this harness I got for my boyfriend. He's got a 34" waist but he's into weightlifting and crossfit, so his legs are massive! This harness turned out to be just perfect for someone with such muscular legs. It's equipped with four loops for gear, adjustable leg straps (and generously sized ones at that!), and it provides a comfortable fit around the waist. We opted for a Large size since I'm planning to take him ice climbing, and I want him to have enough room for layers underneath.
review.name: Perfect fit for big legs!

review.reviewBody:
I am a tall woman (6’1”), with curves (smaller waist, thick thighs) and I was getting discouraged harness shopping. Women’s harnesses were too small in the waist (only carrying up to size “L” frequently) and men’s harnesses had small leg loops. 

I ordered this harness having never heard of the brand. I did my research and found that this is a reputable, affordable, effective harness for gym climbing as well as outdoor climbing. 

It fits like a glove! The waist and leg loops are super adjustable. And the tails tuck into elastic loops so you don’t have any hanging material. 

I love the bright green color, too. It feels fun and a bit less masc than navy or black.
review.name: Awesome fit!

review.reviewBody: This harness is excellent. It fits well and is comfortable to hang in. I'd definitely buy it again.
review.name: Great Harness

review.reviewBody:
I received this as a gift a couple of years ago and have used it about 5 times. Worked great until it started leaking from around the pour spout. Not so good to have liquor all over your backpack when in the backcountry. 
I suggest always storing this in a sealed ziplock bag as a bag up. I’m quite disappointed :(
review.name: Good while it lasts

review.reviewBody: Great little water bottle. Just wish it had a loop to put a biner through.
review.name: Great little water bottle. Just

review.reviewBody: Outstanding container for bringing wine into the back country.
review.name: Outstanding container for bringing wine

review.reviewBody: Compare to any alternative on a fluid oz. to total weight basis and the choice will be clear - essential!
review.name: Compare to any alternative on

review.reviewBody: I use these all the time. Back packing, ski touring, in the city just about everywhere but in the house. Super light and durable.
review.name: Excellent bottle

review.reviewBody: Nice to have a packable solution to traveling with a bottle of wine, saves the anxiety of breaking a bottle.
review.name: Works perfectly!

review.reviewBody: I use it to store unconsumed wine. It works very well. After 3 days, wine tastes the same, better than w a vacuum seal cork. Haven't let wine sit any longer than that (?why would you :-)) BUT after 3 uses, I lost the unattached cap while waiting for the bag to dry. It needs to have a cap loop to connect the cap to the bag. Please add that design team!!
review.name: Good but needs cap to be attached

review.reviewBody: You can tell the cap is 100% air / water tight when you close it.
review.name: Love it.

review.reviewBody: I have been using the PlatyPreserve wine containers for over 5 yrs. for traveling and cruises. They are the best. Easy to use. Add a removable label to ID wine, varietal and date. After use, remove label, rinse three times with clean water to remove residue. When back in town, rinse and fill with warm water. Let sit one day, drain and refill. After three rinses, drain/shake out water residues, turn upside down and allow the container to air dry for a few days. They can be used up to about 10 times, even for bold red wines. Have also used for standard hard liquor (40%/80 proof), and worked effectively. Neither wine or alcohol show up on x-ray inspection units. Never. The recommendation to add a cap retraint for lid is a good one. Lids can get misplaced.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: This is a great way to take a little vino on a backpacking adventure. My wife loves it!
review.name: I would buy it again.

name: PlatyPreserve

review.reviewBody: I just got this and wore today in 45 degrees, mist and 30mph wind. Underneath, I had a silk t-shirt, long sleeve jersey. Was perfect combination for the ride of 33 miles. I like the longer sleeves which have an extended and soft cuff, which offer very good length possibilities. And I like the shell which is more resistant to clingy things which will stick to soft shells. My first impression, before ride, was that it might be too light and not adequate cold protection. It does have very good wind blocking, as I had worn it a short time outdoors before the ride, without any layers underneath. This is a good jacket and surprised me.
review.name: Really good cool/cold weather gear

review.reviewBody: I had a winter jacket that gets the job done but it is somewhat bulky and difficult to pack away if it warms up while you are on a ride.  Enter the Unlimited Puffy Jacket.  This jacket is extremely warm in relation to its weight.  It also packs away and could fit in a jersey pocket although I typically put it on my bar bag.  The jacket is rated to go down to freezing but if you layer underneath given the wind resistance of the jacket it would be fine in the low 20's no problem.  The only reason I gave it 4 stars and not five is that I do get a bit of wind flap on the shoulders over 20mph.  Nothing horrendous but it is noticeable and I would expect near perfection at this price point.  I really like the look of the jacket and the pockets are easy to access you gear/food.  I would buy the jacket again no question and would recommend it to anyone looking for a lightweight but packable option for winter riding.
review.name: Lightweight and Warm

name: Unlimited Puffy Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Overall the Backcountry customer service is the best. I got the Rab Downpour Plus 2 jacket in a Medium. I'm 5'9" 170 lbs. It didn't fit right. I called the customer service rep to see if I could swap out the jacket for a Large. They provided a prepaid Fedex shipping label to return the M and at the same time sent me the L. The large fits great and I've used it twice in the rain and it seems to be fine. The front zipper lays down close to the jacket and requires you to give a little extra attention when you zip the jacket up. Not a deal breaker. I like the color, the fit and length. Btw, the jacket dropped in price twice during this time and the customer service was so kind to refund me that delta.
review.name: Good fit if you buy the right size

name: Downpour Plus 2.0 Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Base Layer Pattern Bottom - Women's
review.reviewBody: I've been wearing Smartwools Classic Merino base layer bottoms for year.. Warm, perfect weight and great fit. Highly recommend....
review.name: Great long underwear

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Base Layer Pattern Bottom - Women's
review.reviewBody: I had bought these to snowshoe in this winter and was excited for the design. I ordered and XL and they were a little big but they didn't have any lages left so I was going to live with it. Except the moment I stepped outside I felt a breeze on my inner thigh. I examined the area and there were multiple holes in the seam. I went to return the product and they were trying to charge for shipping for a product that has a history of being defective and arrived defective. I called to get more details and the person I spoke too said they didn't have any left to even try and exchange and the only money I could get was in store credit. Not pleased. The only I'll be ordering from this store again is to use my online credit.
review.name: Holes as soon as it arrived

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Base Layer Pattern Bottom - Women's
review.reviewBody: The material feels comfy and sturdy.  Love the color/pattern!  Not see thru at all even though it is a very light color for leggings.  Nice wide waistband to help avoid rolling and cutting into your side.  I wanted to love these, but ended up returning because of the fit.  They were very snug in the waist and around the thighs.  The seams on my thighs looked distorted due to how tight they were.  I am a very solid size medium (US size 8-10 in most pants and dresses).  I would have tried exchanging for a size up but I am short and the medium was already a bit long.  I assume the large would be longer.
review.name: Good quality. Snug fit.

name: Classic Thermal Merino Base Layer Pattern Bottom - Women's

review.reviewBody: Great for those destination rides when you want to have extra things with you.  Even used it for an overnight ride(at hotel).  Not too big and heavy but not too small and useless. Easily snaps on/off.  Pressure points are NOT on bracket so seems very stable

review.reviewBody: I've had a black/grey Ortlieb handlebar bag for 10+ years and it's still going strong.  I saw the green color and decided I would order it based on my experience with the same bag.  The green bag I received is not the same bag as pictured.  Instead of the mesh zippered side pockets, mine has water bottle cage mounts.  Instead of a rounded solid fabric top, this green one has a flat top (I call it Frankenstein's Monster, now) with a translucent slot for map or cell phone.  It still fits perfectly into the Ortlieb quick release mount that I have on all my bikes and it stays in place, as expected.  Also, the product description list it as 7L, but the box states that it is 6.5L (I'm guessing .5L is lost to the flat top).....that's quite a bit of space to give up for something this size.
review.name: Mine was different than what is pictured

name: Ultimate 6 Plus 5-8.5L Handlebar Bag

review.reviewBody: I love this coat.  I was looking for something that could provide warmth on the coldest days, while enabling movement and comfort.  Moreover, I didn't want to look like a snowman in it, and this coat gives me a shape despite all of the layers.  It was expensive, and that did give me pause.  However, I rationalized the cost for what I hope will be a long-term staple in my outerwear.
review.name: Fantastic, Warm and Attractive Coat

review.reviewBody: Just moved back to NY from SE Asia and was looking for a stylish, warm jacket. So far, I'm delighted with my purchase.
review.name: Smart, comfortable and warm

review.reviewBody: I purchased this coat in Black. The coat fits true to size. I will advise that if you are a bit curvy especially in the hip area order a size up. I usually wear the coat with either a t-shirt or a normal long sleeve shirt and always feel warm. Sometimes even hot and this is in temperatures  below 32 degrees Fahrenheit. Overall I love my purchase!
review.name: Warm Warm Warm

description: Buy the Lake CX403 Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: CX403 Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Lake CX403 Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
My actual shoe size is somewhere between a 9 and a 9.5, but I end up wearing everything from a size 10 to 11 normally because of my foot width. 
My foot length is just about a 43 and these run true to size for me. Perfect fit! No crammed toes, no squished sides, it’s like heaven to ride in these. 
Like may others have mentioned, they are quite uncomfortable to walk in, but on the bike, they are great.
review.name: Length just right and width is great

review.reviewBody: A super stiff, supportive, no kidding around race shoe. Feet feel like they're in a carbon bathtub. Heat molding is a necessity -- they won't feel right the first time out of the box. Takes multiple tries to get them right, but then they are perfect. Worth the effort. Blue/black a great departure from white or black. Fit seems to be a little small. MSRP ridiculous, but often go on sale.
review.name: Serious, No Compromise Race Shoe

review.reviewBody: Usually my foot is wider than most cycling shoes in my size. These CX403 have a roomy toe box, which makes them comfortable.
review.name: Wide Shoe Comfort

review.reviewBody: It took three passes at the heat molding to get these shoes to being comfortable, and I may still make one more adjustment. Be patient, as everyone reports that they feel terrible right out of the box. They are also not ver comfortable off the bike, but once clipped in the connection to the pedals is fantastic. For me, the wide toe box is a game changer as my feet were getting pinched by all of my prior shoes. These shoes are not featherweights, but I think the terrific power transfer is worth a bit of extra weight. Quality of materials is absolutely first rate and the iridescent blue is very striking.
review.name: Rock Solid, Amazing Quality and Comfort

review.reviewBody: It took me four tries to get these molded to my liking but now they feel great, after feeling horrible right out of the box. The wide toe box is really welcome after years of wearing shoes that were too narrow. The feeling of connection to the pedals and power transfer is really amazing. All of the materials are top notch quality and they seem really well made. Not light by any means but I think the fit makes up for it. I will say they are pretty uncomfortable off the bike.
review.name: Amazing Quality and Fit

review.reviewBody: Just bought my second pair (Chameleon Green at a great price!!) because I truly love these shoes! Using the Lake sizing guide for my first pair I got a 44.5, but it was too small and exchanged for a 45 which fits my 110mm wide feet great. More than enough room in the toe box for me and comfortable all around after oven molding. Stiff soles, beautiful soft leather, BOAs, nice looking(subjective), not cheap, but you get what you pay for!
review.name: Love these shoes!

review.reviewBody: I wear a size 11 US and ordered a 45.5 although the sizing guide says I should order a 44.5. The 45.5 is too small as my toes touch the inside end of the toe box.  I also have normal width feet and ordered the wide which fits fine.  I will return and replace with a size 46.
review.name: Too small

review.reviewBody: I know, it's a lot of money and you already have the top end SIDIs. But nothing is like putting on these shoes, warm out of the oven, and shaping them to your feet before a big ride. The kangaroo uppers handle crashes great - they don't scar easily. Plus, they get softer and softer over time. The BOAs work great for adjusting on the fly, and with a little saddle soap, they stay looking new, crash marks and all. I wear an 11 E dress shoe, and if you have a wide foot, these wides are perfect. When group riding with Type A bikers, I have gotten dropped twisting my BOAs because these LAKEs do get a little looser and require a tad more periodic tightening. That's the price of wearing a shoe that's made with succulent kangaroo glove leather, and where SIDIs may have the tiniest edge. That said, these LAKEs are very stiff and light, and just fine for sprints, climbs, and racing - just keep them snug. You deserve this shoe.
review.name: You Deserve These Shoes
comment: Hi - I called Lake with my foot measurements, I'm 273 actual foot length, both sides, and 101/105mm width for my L/R.  They said I'd want to consider the 44 wide even though my foot isn't wide by normal standards, I wear a D width shoe and think I'm fine in it.  By chance, do you have your foot measurements to compare?  Thanks for any info.

name: CX403 Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Pack Pliers - Master Link Combo Pliers
review.reviewBody: One of the nicest looking bike tools I own. Quick link pliers are a must have and these are sleek and thin. Slide them in your pocket, bike bag or hip pack. They also work great for tightening your valve stem lock nut, and magnetically stores 2 sets of quick links very securely. Have not used the valve core remover but seems like it will work fine. I wouldn't use them as tire levers because there medal and don't want to scratch my rims, but I knew that when I bought them. All in all, there bad ace looking and work good for what I need them for. Extra bonus as a conversation piece and just fidgeting with them when I'm chilling.
review.name: Wolf Tooth Pack Pliers - Gold Bolt

review.reviewBody: The 5 was a big deal for me representing my wife & 4 kids. It’s like they walking with me encouraging me to keep going on the negative days. These kicks spoke to me.

Quality pair of trainers but I haven't worn them on the bike yet!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Haven’t yet worn these on the trail yet, but from the feel of the soles I know that they will be more than capable of some hard riding…..Out of the box they are a great smart-casual trainer, and that’s what I’ve used them for so far.
Will get them caked in mud soon no doubt!

review.reviewBody:
Crazy comfy sandals- at least once I broke them in a bit.
I have 38s in 3 different types of Birkenstocks. (Judge away.)
Out of the box, these were easily the most narrow of the three. I was a bit concerned at first, but once I wore them around a couple days they'd formed to my feet nicely, and I now never want to take them off. 
Classy, with or without socks. ;)

I wear a 38 but most of my shoes are a size 8 or 8.5. 38s are listed as a 7-7.5, and they're slightly longer than my normal 8s. So...for me, they weirdly run small and large. This is why I'm giving them 4 stars instead of 5- can be a bit tricky finding the perfect size. -At least it was for me.
review.name: I'll Take the Lot!

name: Arizona Leather Sandal - Women's

review.reviewBody: I will update when I receive the item, but I am very disappointed in the overall experience.  I needed this item to arrive and was pleased to see the 3-5 business day expedited shipping was free.  I placed the order on a Friday and it was saying it would arrive the following Saturday which was fine.  That would be 5 full business days.  No problem.  It took 3 days before the package was processed by DHL, but I remained hopeful as it arrived within 2 hours of the delivery address a day before the expected delivery date.  It then sat, untouched, for another nearly 2 days while under the USPS control.  Currently it won't be delivered until late Monday- over 48hrs after the predicted date.  I am sure the product will be as expected, but it will arrive too late for it's intended use.
review.name: Horrible shipping experience

name: Rise Series Fly Reel

hasVariant.description: Buy the NiteRider Vmax+ 150 Rear Light online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this light as a back up and I cannot get the light to stay on during my entire ride even when fully charged. I also find it difficult to turn on and then to get to the setting that I want. I'll be the first to say that it might be user error, but I don't think so. This light is going to be given away.
review.name: Very Disappointing

review.reviewBody: The Vmax+150 Rear Light is a wonderful upgrade to the alkaline battery powered tail light that performed admirably for me until it was lost after breaking-free from my saddlebag. The Vmax+150 is compact and quite powerful compared to that predecessor rear light. In particular, I value the compact size because now there is room to position the mounting strap & light below my saddlebag on the bike seat post/frame. The variety of run modes (6) is also useful for choosing the right setting when biking solo or on a group ride or during different times of the day. The mounting strap is of high quality and appears to the same for most of the NiteRider tail lights. I know this because my NiteRider Solas 30 rear light acquired nearly ten years ago came with the identical mounting strap which I've saved and can now attach to my other bike to facilitate using the Vmax+150 on whatever set of wheels I decide to ride.
review.name: Excellent Cycling Light from NiteRider

name: Vmax+ 150 Rear Light

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am pretty impressed with this pack. I have a few very high end hunting packs and they always seem to cut off some hip circulation. With a 3 night off trial campsite this pack was fantastic! I was skeptical but this pack performed very well. I really liked the U-zip access, huge hip pockets, and the side pockets that I can grab a waterbottle from while wearing the pack. 
A couple of things I didn't like: those huge hip pockets left no room for a bear spray holster, there is no way for the lid to double as a separate pack for little jaunts from camp, and the hip belt was maxed tight on my 34" waist in the Med/LG frame choice. I could get the waist belt tight enough but if I stopped eating cookies...
review.name: Impressed

review.reviewBody: I've been using my Zulu 65 for the past few months... some late summer & fall backpacking trips and winter river trip. It's one of the most comfortable packs I've used before, and it has great pockets for side gear and wallet/phone/keys access. I've used it for one to three day backpacking trips and it's been perfect. I plan on putting it to the test for a week trip coming up soon. Gregory just makes solid packs!
review.name: My favorite pack!

name: Zulu 65L Backpack
